intro: Irvingella klainei, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants known for their unique floral structures and ecological adaptations. The plant is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. Irvingella klainei typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in dry woodland and savanna habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
